meanings.sent1: In our town, the local lingo is full of unique lingoes.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to understand the foreign lingo spoken by the tourists.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seem to have their own little lingoes they chirp about.
meanings.sent4: The lingoes of technology can be as complex as learning a new language.
meanings.sent5: The lingoes of the ancient civilization were a mystery to the archaeologists.

meanings.definition: The vocabulary or jargon of a particular subject or group.
meanings.sent1: The lingoes of medical professionals can be hard to understand for patients.
meanings.sent2: He quickly picked up the lingoes used by the engineers at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The kids at the coding club have their own secret lingoes they use.
meanings.sent4: The lingoes of the art world can sometimes be intimidating to newcomers.
meanings.sent5: Learning the lingoes of the music industry was essential for her new job.
